snippet: Our colleagues at Bucks offer a report on the issue of who pays in an accident caused by a driver's texting.
abstract: Our colleagues at Bucks offer a report on the issue of who pays in an accident caused by a driver's texting.
lead_paragraph: Our colleagues at Bucks report on a provocative idea floated by a man from Boulder, Colo., who suggested, in a letter published in The Wall Street Journal, that insurance companies refuse to pay claims for accidents caused by texting. But industry representatives reached by Bucks said that the proposal may be a nonstarter. Read more at Bucks »

headline.main: What If Insurers Didn't Pay for Crashes Caused by Texting?
